title: Trump puts brakes on Biden's green transition
summary: The Republican has announced the end of his predecessor's environmental policies and declared war on wind turbines. However, he won't be able to undo the measures already passed by Congress, and many ambiguities remain surrounding his project.

title: Trump and Newsom warmly greet each other in Los Angeles before the president tours wildfire damage
summary: The governor said California will need the federal government’s help and support. 'I have all the expectations we’re going to be able to work together.' Newsom has pushed back against some of Trump’s criticism of the state’s handling of the wildfires but also needs the federal government to approve wildfire assistance. 'We’re going to get it fixed,' Trump responded.

title: Trump calls on Saudi Arabia to lower oil prices to induce Russia to negotiate on Ukraine
summary: In his video address to the Davos Forum, the American president urged Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman to reduce the cost of crude oil. The objective is to limit Russian state revenues and force Vladimir Putin to consider a political resolution to the Ukrainian conflict.

title: Zelensky warns Putin wants to 'manipulate' Trump on Ukraine
summary: Neither side has shown signs of de-escalating hostilities since Trump's inauguration, despite the President claiming he would end the conflict in '24 hours' once in power.

title: US State Department freezes new funding for nearly all US aid programs worldwide
summary: Humanitarian and military aid to Israel and Egypt will be allowed to continue despite the suspension.

title: Taylor Sheridan, showrunner darling of Trump's America
summary: The creator of Paramount's hit series 'Yellowstone' is developing furrther TV shows for the network that align with the Republican president's positions.

title: Meta plans to invest at least $60 billion in AI in 2025
summary: Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg revealed that the social media giant will invest heavily in artificial intelligence, expecting the company's tool to become the most popular one among consumers.

title: Storm Eowyn hits Ireland and Scotland
summary: Hundreds of thousands of homes lost power as gusts of 183 kilometers per hour lashed the western coast of Ireland. In Scotland, hundreds of schools were closed and train operator ScotRail suspended all services.

title: Russia delivers armored vehicles to Mali and restructures military presence
summary: Around 100 vehicles, including light tanks and armored vehicles, arrived in Bamako from Guinea on January 17, just as the Russian Defense Ministry intends to speed up the replacement of the Wagner group by Africa Corps in the country. Le Monde traced the convoy.

title: Hamas names next Israeli hostages set to be released
summary: Hamas identified four female Israeli soldiers who will be freed in the next prisoner swap as part of the ceasefire agreement between Hamas and Israel.

title: How California became Republicans' punching bag
summary: Donald Trump is visiting fire-ravaged Los Angeles on Friday to practice the transactional approach he now intends to apply to relations between Washington and the US states: no humanitarian aid without a minimum of cooperation.

title: DRC regional governor killed on front line fighting against M23 rebels
summary: The DRC army and UN peacekeepers clashed with M23 rebels on Friday outside Goma as the United Kingdom, United States and France urged citizens to leave the main city in DRC's volatile east, warning that the situation could deteriorate rapidly.

title: At Davos, business leaders are fascinated and concerned with 'deal-maker' Trump
summary: Even the elites of the World Economic Forum are seduced by the American president's forceful actions. To the point of forgetting the contradictions and risks of his agenda.

title: French skier Alexis Pinturault airlifted from course with knee injury
summary: The three-time Olympic medallist, making his comeback after rupturing a knee ligament a year ago, crashed in a men's World Cup super-G on Friday.

title: Louvre president warns of dilapidated buildings
summary: In a letter to the French Culture Minister Rachida Dati, Laurence des Cars expresses her concern about defects in watertightness endangering works of art and inadequate reception conditions for a growing number of visitors.

title: Valérie André, France's first female general, has died
summary: She was a helicopter pilot during the Indochina War and served four years in Algeria. She was also the first woman to be appointed physician general and to be awarded a third star. Decorated with the Grand Cross of the Legion of Honor, she died on January 21, aged 102.

title: PFAS: France's drinking water is massively contaminated by 'forever chemicals,' including in Paris
summary: Two separate campaigns conducted by the Eurofins laboratory and the UFC-Que Choisir and Générations Futures associations reveal high concentrations of trifluoroacetic acid (TFA).

title: Norway accused of profiting from war in Ukraine
summary: According to the Finance Ministry in Oslo, the country has reaped 1,270 billion kroner (€107.7 billion) in additional revenue thanks to higher gas prices and production. It has been criticized for allocating only a fraction of this on aid to Ukraine.

title: Kidnappers of French crypto figure and his wife arrested after massive manhunt
summary: David Balland, co-founder of the Ledger company, was abducted from his home along with his wife on the morning of Tuesday, January 21. They were successfully rescued by law enforcement. Ten people, aged between 20 and 40, were arrested and taken into custody.

title: German man sets world record living for 120 days underwater
summary: To celebrate his feat of living in a submerged capsule off the coast of Panama, Rudiger Koch, 59, toasted with champagne and smoked a cigar before leaping into the Caribbean Sea, where a boat picked him up and took him to dry land for a celebratory party.

title: VP Vance breaks US Senate tie to confirm Hegseth as Pentagon chief
summary: Trump, while boarding Air Force One on Friday, talked up his defense secretary pick Pete Hegseth moments before Vance cast the tiebreaking vote to confirm him.

title: Paris Fashion Week: When fashion houses focus on presentations
summary: Some brands unveil their men's lines in their showrooms, without going through the catwalk. This makes it possible to appreciate the details up close, like the pearl embroidery at Dries Van Noten or the prints on jeans at Acne Studios.

title: Fewer cars but more outdoor socializing: The changing sound of Paris
summary: Fifteen years of political and social change in the capital have shifted noise from the roads to bar and restaurant terraces. As car noise levels have fallen, individual loud sounds have become more noticeable and less tolerated by local residents.

title: US private security company to be deployed in the Gaza Strip
summary: American armed guards are to be stationed on the Netzarim corridor, an axis that cuts the Palestinian enclave in two. Their role will be to inspect the vehicles of Gazans displaced in the south of the territory and wishing to return to the north.

title: Jia Zhang-ke, director of 'Caught by the Tides': 'I wanted to break away from the tradition of linear storytelling'
summary: In an interview with 'Le Monde,' the Chinese director explains how he came up with his new film, which features a striking collage of images pulled from his archives and traces the genealogy of the present day.

title: Hamas releases four Israeli hostages
summary: The four hostages are women soldiers aged 19 to 20, who were kidnapped on October 7, 2023. They were handed over to the Red Cross and then taken to Israel by the military.

title: 'David Lynch's wildly ambiguous, sometimes incomprehensible films are magnificent aberrations'
summary: Struggling to understand the films of David Lynch, who died on January 16, is not a problem, because the American director intended to activate our sensations and the thinking machine working inside us, writes Le Monde columnist Michel Guerrin.

title: Australian Open: Madison Keys upsets Aryna Sabalenka to win first major
summary: Keys of the United States beat the two-time defending champion Sabalenka of Belarus 6-3, 2-6, 7-5 in the women's singles final.

title: 'We were beaten, blindfolded': Former Palestinian prisoner recounts detention and release
summary: Alaa Shahani, 37, convicted of 'incitement to violence,' was one of 90 Palestinians released on Sunday, January 19, in exchange for three Israeli hostages as part of the ceasefire agreement in Gaza.

title: Seven held in France for kidnapping and torture of crypto figure
summary: Most of the suspects were already known to police for past criminal activities, but none had previously been involved in gang-related crime, according to prosecutors.

title: Thirty-five years after reunification, Germany still straddles two capitals
summary: With only a few weeks to go before Germany's parliamentary elections, the political establishment is once again arguing over which institutions should be shared between Berlin and Bonn.

title: Why Europe's drive to rearm is stalling
summary: A range of obstacles – political, industrial, technical, strategic – is slowing Europe's rearmament despite the war in Ukraine and pressure from the new American president.

title: War in Sudan: Drone strike on hospital kills 67 people
summary: The strike on one of the last operational hospitals in El-Fasher, Darfur, also injured dozens more. The attack comes amid escalating violence between Sudan's army and the paramilitary RSF.

title: 'It's hard to see how Elon Musk will be able to find $1 trillion in savings'
summary: The billionaire American entrepreneur was appointed head of a mission to reduce the federal government's size. But his promises seem fanciful, argues journalist Pascal Riché in his column.

title: 'David Lynch examined an America in the grip of evil'
summary: Critic and director Thierry Jousse argues that David Lynch's vision took on a quasi-political dimension in his final work, 'Twin Peaks: The Return,' which resonates with the troubled times we live in.

title: Elon Musk addresses German far-right rally by video
summary: Also on Saturday, thousands of Germans protested against the rise of the far-right and anti-immigrant Alternative for Germany (AfD) party ahead of a February 23 general election.

title: Kristi Noem confirmed by Senate to lead Department of Homeland Security
summary: The South Dakota governor will be tasked with leading border security and immigration enforcement under Trump's administration.

title: 13 peacekeepers killed in eastern DRC, where Congolese army battles Rwandan-backed M23 fighters
summary: Some 15,000 peacekeepers are present in the Democratic Republic of Congo. The UN has begun evacuating 'non-essential' staff from Goma to neighbouring Uganda and to the Congolese capital Kinshasa. Britain, the United States and France on Friday asked their citizens to leave Goma.

title: Wembanyama's Spurs lose to Haliburton-inspired Pacers in Paris
